fields.biography: Hi. I'm Nicholas Fechner-Mills and I am the photo editor for the 2016-2017 school year. I like to take photos and I also like to make videos with BNC. I hope you enjoy the photo coverage of sports and Blair news.
Hey, my name's Morgan and I'm SCO's photo editor. I love dogs and running, both track and cross country. From photos of people to landscapes, I adore taking pictures of everything.
My name is Ryan Handel, and I'm a Staff Writer for Silver Chips Online. I'm on the Blair wrestling team and in my spare time I enjoy watching sports and advocating for the Arthritis Foundation.
I'm just a dude who likes spending time with his dog.

Zo Friedman is a junior at Montgomery Blair HS. She loves running XC and track, exercising, writing, cooking, marketing and creating business ideas. She's self-published two cookbooks since her freshman year. In her free time, she watches baseball and makes and packages her own energy bars.

I write, I play soccer and I build things for stage crew.
 Game of Thrones books>T.V show
I love soccer, cheer, and track. I'm excited to be writing for SCO.
Hi, I'm Amy. I love drinking coffee, trying tasty new foods and doing yoga. I also enjoy running and relaxing.
My name is Mehana Daftary and I am an Editor-in-Chief for Silver Chips Online. I am a member of Blair's acapella group InToneNation and I enjoy singing and reading.

Hi, I'm Abby, SCO's Video Editor. Come to me if you want to have an in-depth discussion on Disney movies or gluten-free foods. Check out all of SCO's videos here: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UChQKJ8Jyaw6tgZUWha6SFSg.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KyosPwwTl7s
Hey, I am Absa and I hope you read all of my fantastic stories! I am a Leo (just like my homeboy Barack Obama- one day I will meet you) and I love reading. Uh, so cool sauce, see you later.
Hi! I'm Mahnaz and am a staff writer. I love to hang out with friends, read, and watch Stranger Things. I also dance and play the violin.
My name is Sneha. I am a nerd on the inside and the outside. I have a passion for STEM and sleeping.

Katie Calingaert is a junior at Blair and a junior SCO staffer. She enjoys the choir and guitar program(s) at Blair and is very involved in them. Outside of school she is interested in political activism, art, and taking long naps with her cats. She completed the Democracy Summer Fellowship program under the tutelage of Congressman Jamie Raskin.  She really enjoys memes and only after writing this did she discover that she learned she also thoroughly enjoyed speaking about herself in the third person.
Hi I'm Arthi Thyagarajan! I am super excited to be writing for Silver Chips Online this year. I also enjoy playing soccer on my school team and watching Game of Thrones.
Hi, I'm Maddy. I enjoy rowing for the Blair Crew team, teasing my friends, and spending time with my cat and dogs.
My name is Noah Stern and I love sports. I am an aspiring sports broadcaster and have an article written in The Washington Post.

Birthday: after World War II
My dream occupation? Employed.
My favorite color: pink.
My favorite time: nap time.

I love practicing archery, karate, tae-kwon-do, skating, singing, and napping.
Howdy Y'all--I'm on SCO photo staff, and I enjoy backpacking, skiing and being on the water, be it for Blair crew or otherwise.
I am admin.

fields.title: #NationalWalkoutDay
fields.description: Blair students were some of the thousands that marched to the White House in protest for gun control.

fields.title: dry
fields.description: Hand dryers are more eco-friendly but less effective and hygienic than paper towels.

fields.title: dryer
fields.description: Hand dryers are more eco-friendly but less effective and hygienic than paper towels.

fields.title: A Young Advocate
fields.description: Blair senior Brenna Levitan organized Wednesday's march and has since been heavily involved in Montgomery County's MocoForGunControl as they promote change in control for student's safety.

fields.title: First Day of Spring
fields.description: Freshman Maya Frey poses in the snow after the largest snow fall Maryland has seen this year.

fields.title: Enough
fields.description: Freshman Maya Frey holds up her sign that reads "Enough is Enough" at the March for Our Lives protest for more gun control in D.C.

fields.title: Swarming the Capital
fields.description: People flood the streets leading to the Capital with signs in hand at the March for Our Lives.

fields.title: Mixed Messages
fields.description: A man holds a sign reading "Mass Shootings Require Guns" while others have written "Don't Shoot" on their hands showing the borrowing of messages of Black Lives Matter protests and the struggle of race representation in the March for Our Lives.

fields.title: Demands
fields.description: A sign is held up demanding gun reform and stricter gun control, protesters joining together to keep guns out of the streets at the March for Our Lives.

fields.title: Stand Tall and Strong
fields.description: Freshman Elise Haverland holds up her sign to show support for the March for Our Lives and their call for stricter gun control in America.

fields.title: Hashtag
fields.description: A sign reading "#Never Again" is held up in the air, a common slogan created after the MSD high school shooting.

fields.title: Ruby Farber
fields.description: Ruby Farber

fields.title: Spring Has Sprung
fields.description: Passers-by can spot chickens roaming Silver Spring and Takoma Park as warm weather finally arrives in Maryland.

fields.title: Cheryl Bost
fields.description: Cheryl Bost was one among 2,000 Maryland educators that marched in Annapolis.

fields.title: footsie
fields.description: Playing tackle football in a team builds values and creates a lasting comradeship between players.

fields.title: ballers
fields.description: For players, football means family.

fields.title: Button
fields.description: To request to open doors, visitors have to press this button and wait for a click.

fields.title: Door
fields.description: Students and visitors are required to enter the building through the main entrance after 8 am.

fields.title: Seasonal Flowers
fields.description: As we get further into the season, a variety of different flowers begin to bloom, making it feel a lot more like spring.

fields.title: Spring Awakening
fields.description: Dandelions bloom and blow apart in the wind as spring arrives in Maryland.

fields.title: Sunflowers
fields.description: Sunflowers begin to bloom as spring weather finally arrives in Maryland.

fields.title: Take Me Out to the Ball Game
fields.description: As winter comes to an end and spring starts, the baseball team is out on the field playing against their rival schools.

fields.title: Artwork Float
fields.description: Maggie O'Neil, the 2018 official festival artist, stands atop the float she designed while decked out in various shades on pink and blue.

fields.title: Tamagawa Dancers
fields.description: Filled with joy, Tamagawa University's dancers lighten the mood with their energetic and passionate performance.

fields.title: A Trail of Blossoms
fields.description: The fallen cherry blossoms make a beautiful trail across the Tidal Basin and to Jefferson Memorial.

fields.title: Blossom Kite Festival
fields.description: The annual Blossom Kite Festival is an anticipated family event filled with competitions, demonstrations, and creatively made kites.

fields.title: Blossoms in Bloom
fields.description: With spring in full bloom, a plethora of cherry blossoms decorate the area surrounding the Tidal Basin.

fields.title: Cherry Blossom Festival Parade
fields.description: Showcasing colorful floats, celebrity entertainers, and performances from a variety of genres, the National Cherry Blossom Festival Parade is one of the most popular DC events that happens this time of year.

fields.title: Tamagawa Drummers
fields.description: As the parade continues, the Tamagawa University Dance and Taiko group arrive, quickly boosting the atmosphere with their energetic music and enthusiasm.

fields.title: In the Sky
fields.description: During the annual Blossom Kite Festival, a kite worth $700 flies high in the sky near the Washington Monument.

fields.title: In the Crowd
fields.description: A woman takes a picture of the kites in the sky as she wear a cherry blossom headbands that could be purchases by festival patrons.

fields.title: Blooming
fields.description: You know it's spring when you see the white and pink buds of the cherry blossoms fill downtown D.C.

fields.title: Get Blazed
fields.description: The Blazer pumps up the crowd with chants and cheers during the spring pep rally.

fields.title: TuBAd You're Not As Cool As This Guy
fields.description: Blair marching band member, Amanuel, plays tuba during the pep rally.

fields.title: Ready to MC
fields.description: MC Dagmawi Tsegaye smiles for the cameras before the pep rally.

fields.title: Dancing Queen
fields.description: Olivia, a member of the African dance team, shows off some of her moves.

fields.title: EdEnergized
fields.description: Eden Treado leads the Blair marching band in the chant "Go Blazers!"

fields.title: Hip Hop
fields.description: Senior Vahana Ayikoe (@moosezami) participates in Spirit Week by dressing with the theme "Hip Hop" in mind.

fields.title: Just Do It
fields.description: Upperclassman wear the iconic Nike slash on Nike spirit day.

fields.title: Ole Timer
fields.description: Senior Mikaela Moore dresses as a grandmother for Monday's spirit day of grandparents versus babies.
Seniors chant "1-8", their graduating year, as they compete with the other classes to be the most spirited during the pep rally.

fields.title: Ice Cold
fields.description: An old Coca-Cola box rusts outside of a house in Takoma Park.

fields.title: In Bloom
fields.description: A variety of flowers begin popping around the DMV area as we get more into spring, including orchids.

fields.title: Lavender Bushes
fields.description: Flowers are popping up and coloring Silver Spring with the bright buds as the weather continues to warm up!

fields.title: Happy Mother's Day!
fields.description: Happy Mother's Day

fields.title: Hot Pink
fields.description: Water Lilies peeked out this week, providing some color after several days of straight rain in Montgomery County.

fields.title: A Pirate King
fields.description: The pirate crew, led by the Pirate King (Sam Newman) sing about how wonderful they believe their pirate lifestyle to be; they wouldn't give it up for anything!

fields.title: Anguish
fields.description: Frederic (De'Andre Johnson) falls to the floor in anguish as he realizes that the deal he made to leave the pirate crew is void until he has 21 birthdays. His birthday, however, is a Leap Day.

fields.title: What To Do?
fields.description: The policemen for the town are introduced with a fast-paced song in which they sing about who they are, what they do, and how they will solve the pirate problem.

fields.title: Attack of the Pirates
fields.description: The pirates come to rob the Major General's estate and end up getting into a brawl with his 27 daughters.

fields.title: At My Mercy
fields.description: Frederic (De'Andre Johnson), ex-pirate, holds the Pirate King (Sam Newman) and sword point during the first encounter they've had since Frederic left the pirate life.

fields.title: Love At First Date
fields.description: Mabel (Julianna Ingram) and Frederic (De'Andre Johnson) happily go out on their first date, while Mabel's spying sisters lurk around the corner.

fields.title: I'll Wait for You
fields.description: Mabel (Julianna Ingram) smiles brightly as she makes a promise to Frederic (De'Andre Johnson) to stay faithful to him, forever and always.

fields.title: Don't Touch!
fields.description: A cactus at the national arboretum unfurls its spiky appendages.

fields.title: Shaved Ice
fields.description: Students cool down in the courtyard Friday, enjoying free shaved ice from Carmens on student appreciation day.

fields.title: Always be prepared
fields.description: It's impossible to tell when your car will break down far away from the nearest tow truck or town, so it's better just to be prepared.

fields.title: Blair student accidentally injures a teacher
fields.description: On Monday, Nov. 27 during lunch, junior Blake threw a clay rock over the banister above Blair Boulevard, which fell on the head of teacher Elizabeth, who happened to be walking past the financial office on the first floor. The teacher ended up with a bleeding gash, a small lump on her head and headaches. Using Blair's security cameras, school administrators reviewed the incident in detail for evidence.

fields.title: Students' lack of language learning
fields.description: For some students, four years of hard work in a language program at Blair can result in a deep and holistic understanding of a foreign language. Unfortunately, this is rarely the case.

fields.title: The Bachelor Week 2 recap and Week 3 predictions
fields.description: This past week on the Bachelor, Arie, our graying, race-car-driving, dad-bod-rocking Bachelor, kicked off the season by officially becoming Becca K.'s sugar daddy. Arie then decided that his date with Krystal would be a good time to fly her all the way to Arizona to meet his entire family.

fields.title: Confidentiality concerns arise with the new countywide counselor sign-up
fields.description: Students are now required to fill out a detailed online Google form each time they visit the counseling office, in compliance with a new Montgomery County Public School (MCPS) mandate.

fields.title: FDA approves first digital pill
fields.description: The FDA recently approved a pill that can track whether the patient has ingested the pill or not. It's called "Abilify MyCite," and aims to treat schizophrenia, and manic and mixed episodes associated with bipolar I.

fields.title: The Bachelor Week 3 recap and Week 4 predictions
fields.description: Arie planned yet another concussion-inducing date this past week. This time he brought the women to a makeshift wrestling ring where they fake fought one another.

fields.title: What Happens Next?
fields.description: For Olivia, a Blair freshman, church has a powerful presence in her life. Her uncle is a priest and her mother is a well respected congregant. Yet, two years ago, the arrival of a new deacon  changed her view of the church entirely.

fields.title: Part Two: What Happens Next?
fields.description: Despite the increased media scrutiny of sexual misconduct in the workplace, several groups of people have gotten woefully less coverage of their experiences. This series of investigations reveals the unique struggles that teenagers face in reporting sexual misconduct by teachers and authority figures, and the ways in which their voices were silenced.

fields.title: Black Mirror Season 4 Review
fields.description: Black Mirror, produced by Netflix, has been gaining a large following throughout the world ever since the first episodes began broadcasting on England's Channel 4 in 2011. Now on Netflix, Charlie Bookers' Sci-Fi anthology returned for a fourth season, comprising of six independent episodes that can be watched in any order.

fields.title: Blazers try new moves in dominant win vs Einstein
fields.description: The Blair Blazers (24-4) won handily over the Einstein Titans (0-10) 72-8 on Jan. 18 after the match was postponed from the day before due to the snow closure.

fields.title: Ridiculous regions
fields.description: On Nov. 17, the undefeated Damascus Hornets clashed with the also undefeated Walkersville Lions in an epic matchup of two football dynasties.

fields.title: Is your iPhone getting slower?
fields.description: Apple recently confirmed a long-held suspicion that they are slowing down older generations of iPhones in new software updates.

fields.title: Stepping up the game
fields.description: Sophomore Justin Haddad comes home on a Friday afternoon, packs his fencing gear, and hops on a plane to Portland for his next competition.

fields.title: Blazer Social Media Stars: Youtube Edition
fields.description: Diane Dao bobs her head as she listens to BTS. She ponders possible dance routines in her head over and over for her next video. Meanwhile, Ayse Erbas, junior, sits on her bed and considers different challenges she could do for her next video and who to collab with.

fields.title: The Bachelor Week 4 recap and Week 5 predictions
fields.description: This week on the Bachelor, the women packed their bags and headed to Tahoe. On the other seasons of the The Bachelor, they usually go abroad to places like Switzerland or St. Lucia, but Arie thought it would be better to take them to... Tahoe?

fields.title: New bike lanes to make Montgomery County more bike-friendly
fields.description: Montgomery County is piloting a new comprehensive bicycle lane network. According to the Montgomery County Bicycle Master Plan, the goals of the new network are to increase bicycling rates in Montgomery County, create a convenient and low-stress bicycling network, provide equal access to low-stress bicycling for all members of the community and improve bicycling safety.

fields.title: Lessons learned from a giant
fields.description: Fee-fi-fo-fum! I can see the giant's shadow just around the corner. Fee-fi-fo-fum! Just a few more steps and I'll be able to see it. Fee-fi-fo-fum! Finally...I have arrived at my destination - at the toes of a giant - at the doors of Facebook, the (social media) giant.

fields.title: Varsity girls basketball overpowers Wheaton
fields.description: The Montgomery Blair Blazers (7-6) defeated the Wheaton Knights (6-7) by a score of 54-38 on Tuesday, January 15th. The game started out slowly, the Blazers playing with caution till they got a sense of their competition.

fields.title: Part Three: What Happens Next?
fields.description: Despite the increased media scrutiny of sexual misconduct in the workplace, several groups of people have gotten woefully less coverage of their experiences. This series of investigations reveals the unique struggles that teenagers face in reporting sexual misconduct by teachers and authority figures, and the ways in which their voices were silenced.

fields.title: Cold days do not mean global warming is a hoax
fields.description: "In the East, it could be the COLDEST New Year's Eve on record. Perhaps we could use a little bit of that good old Global Warming" President Trump tweeted on Dec. 28. Trump's mockery of people who believe that climate change is real is based on the false assumption that one can make generalizations about the climate based on the weather of a few days.

fields.title: Hands-free is not risk-free
fields.description: Self-driving cars are no longer a science fiction fantasy. They're a reality that has hit the roads and could soon dominate them in the next few years. As of October 2016, all Tesla vehicles are being equipped with HW2 (Hardware 2), the new enhanced autopilot/full self-driving feature.

fields.title: How to spot a fire technician
The Bachelor Week 5 recap and Week 6 predictions
fields.description: This week on The Bachelor, the cast headed to Fort Lauderdale, Florida. Chelsea goes on the coveted one-on-one date. Arie brings her on a yacht, to which Chelsea exclaims cheesily, "I'm on a dreamboat with a dreamboat!"

fields.title: Girls basketball blows out Springbrook
fields.description: The Blair Blazers (11-4) defeated the Springbrook Blue Devils (3-10-1) with a final score of 71-44 on Wednesday, January 31.

fields.title: Chromebooks should be used to their fullest potential
fields.description: As technology becomes a more essential part of our education and lives, certain security precautions taken by MCPS have begun to limit the range of what students can accomplish with the free technology they are provided at school.

fields.title: Emmanuel Jal returns to Blair
fields.description: On January 18, Blazers filled the auditorium during fourth period to watch as multi-talented artist, Emmanuel Jal, a former child soldier, shared his life story. Jal spoke of his hardships as an 8-year-old soldier in the Second Sudanese Civil War.

fields.title: Blackout means time's up
fields.description: On Sunday Jan. 7, 19 million people turned the TV on to watch the 2018 Golden Globe Awards. This year, the awards show did more than just announce the winners of "Best Supporting Actress" or "Best Motion Picture." Many viewers may have noticed a common wardrobe color among many the movie stars: black.

fields.title: LoveSCOpe is back
fields.description: Silver Chips Online is calling all single-and-looking Blazers! If you're a single Blazer without love this Valentine's Day season, click here to fill out an application for LoveSCOpe.

fields.title: Blair students receive full-tuition Posse scholarships
fields.description: Ten Montgomery County Public School (MCPS) students were selected for full-tuition, four-year college scholarships from the Posse Foundation, a program which identifies public high school students with outstanding academic and leadership potential but have been overlooked by the traditional college selection process. Out of these ten MCPS students, three Blair seniors were selected: Marc Monteil, Darien Price and Samuel Teshome.

fields.title: SCOs biweekly NBA power rankings
fields.description: Welcome to SCOs very first NBA power rankings, where we rank the National Basketball Association teams based on what their record is and how they played in the week prior. We are more than halfway through the 2017-18 season, and the playoffs are starting to take shape.

fields.title: Blair seniors excel in Regeneron Science Talent Search
fields.description: On Jan. 23, the Society for Science and the Public and Regeneron named 40 finalists for the annual Regeneron Science Talent Search. Of these 40 high school seniors from across the nation, four of them hailed from Montgomery Blair High School, an astounding one tenth of all finalists.

fields.title: Snowy solutions
fields.description: While snow falls and students are sound asleep, Montgomery County Public Schools (MCPS) administrators are up at 3 a.m., racing around and checking the weather forecasts. The seemingly small notification that pops up on the MCPS website before school starts has a big decision making process behind it, and even wider impacts on the community.

fields.title: Seven fun ways to spend Valentine's Day if you're single
fields.description: For those in love, Valentine's Day is a time to embrace your relationship and reflect on all the reasons why you love one another. But for some of us single people, there's no better holiday to get us bummed out about being alone. Even if you're not doing that great in the romance department this year, that doesn't mean you can't go out and enjoy yourself!

fields.title: The Bachelor Week 6 recap and Week 7 Predictions
fields.description: This week, the women and Arie travel across the Atlantic to Paris. When the women get to their hotel, which is really a giant boat, they are informed of a two-on-one date, where two girls will go and only one can stay.

fields.title: A shameful legacy
fields.description: Legacy advantage is a practice used in the college admissions process which gives a boost to the applications of students who are related to alumni of that college or university. It is often claimed by admissions officers that legacy is only taken into consideration when choosing between two equally qualified candidates, as it says on Harvard's admissions website, "Among a group of similarly distinguished applicants, the daughters and sons of Harvard College alumni/ae may receive an additional look."

fields.title: The second Renaissance
fields.description: For the last decade, humanity has been on the precipice of creating technology that will rewrite the world as we know it. Technological advancements are being made across all fields, including medicine, communications and transportation, that will dramatically shape the way millions live their lives.

fields.title: The Bachelor Week 7 recap and Week 8 predictions
fields.description: In Week Seven, the Bachelor heads to Tuscany, Italy. The girls are informed that there will be three one-on-one dates this week followed by a group date, but no rose ceremony. This means that only the girls who get roses on dates will go on to hometowns.

fields.title: Part one of four: meet the Student Member of the Board (SMOB) candidates
fields.description: The nominating convention will take place on Feb. 21 at Watkins Mill High School.

fields.title: Part two of four: Meet the Student Member of the Board (SMOB) candidates
fields.description: The nominating convention will take place on Feb. 21 at Watkins Mill High School.

fields.title: Part Three of Four: Meet the Student Member of the Board (SMOB) candidates
fields.description: The nominating convention will take place on Feb. 21 at Watkins Mill High School.

fields.title: Part Four of Four: Meet the Student Member of the Board (SMOB) candidates
fields.description: The nominating convention will take place on Feb. 21 at Watkins Mill High School.

fields.title: Blazers walk out in support of gun control
fields.description: Students from all across D.C. and Maryland participated in the "Enough is Enough: Students for gun control legislation" protest organized by Richard Montgomery High School student Daniel Gelillo today in Washington, D.C. to protest gun violence. This protest comes in the wake of the school shooting in Parkland, Florida last Wednesday that left 17 dead.

fields.title: Celebrate good times, come on!
fields.description: With February coming to a close, there are great opportunities to celebrate and learn about black history (though you can do that all year). Here are some of the best ways...

fields.title: Losing Lockers
fields.description: As the number of students at Blair is expected to surpass 3,000 students next year and the overcrowding problem is anticipated to grow throughout MCPS, it is clear that the schools must clear the space that lockers take up and use it in a more productive manner.

fields.title: The Bachelor Week 8 recap and Week 9 predictions
fields.description: Hometowns! One of the most highly anticipated episodes every season.

fields.title: MoCo students welcome students from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School
fields.description: On Monday evening, Montgomery Blair High School hosted a town hall meeting for Montgomery County (MoCo) high school students to meet and talk to students from Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School, where the school shooting in Parkland, Fla. took place.

fields.title: A Chief is coming to Washington
fields.description: The Redskins entered the 2018 offseason with a familiar feeling of disappointment. The 2017-2018 campaign saw Washington miss out on the playoffs for the second consecutive year, and go a subpar 7-9, including a dismal 1-5 in division games. Washington is faced with a crucial offseason, where they are attempting to put together the missing pieces to make a winning team. The first piece has already been acquired.

fields.title: Dedication to animation
fields.description: Behind the scenes of films such as Mulan, Toy Story, and Coco, there is a team of artists who put their noses to the grindstone in order to achieve the animated prowess displayed in these films. Even the lighting of a candle requires tedious work and close attention to detail. Animating a flame to look even somewhat realistic is a skill that few people have as it is not easy to master, and requires a lot of time and devotion in order to become proficient.

fields.title: Discovery Communications to leave Silver Spring
fields.description: Discovery Communications, the company behind Shark Week and Animal Planet, is relocating its global headquarters from Silver Spring, Md. to New York City in the latter half of 2019 to keep up with its advertisement partners and investors on Wall Street. Discovery will keep its government relations department in Maryland.

fields.title: Heating issues cause problems in the winter months
fields.description: Many classrooms in Blair, and other schools in Montgomery County, have reached extremely hot or cold temperatures in winter months due to faulty heating, ventilation and air-conditioning (HVAC) systems. This creates an uncomfortable learning environment for both teachers and students.

fields.title: New Year, New Classes
fields.description: Although Blair already offers a unique variety of electives in Science, Social Studies and Art topics, this school year provided an opportunity for many teachers to offer brand new and unique electives that delve into specific areas of these subjects, such as feminism and advertising.

fields.title: Girls' advocacy at Blair
fields.description: Women have been historically underrepresented in the workforce and have had fight for basic rights. Despite the recent push for women's advocacy, girls today still face many challenges. Girl Up, Code Girls and Women's Advocacy are three clubs at Blair that are trying to make the world a better place to be a girl.

fields.title: The backbone of Blair
fields.description: "I think sometimes students think they have to do it alone now that they're in high school, or their friends are the only one they can go to. But there's a reason that they have a support system, we're always here to help," says Ms. Binnick, one of the many counselors at Blair, here to provide that extra support that everyone sometimes needs.

fields.title: Anyone can earn it
fields.description: They hang off bulletin boards, sit on shelves or are worn with pride on the front of a jacket. Varsity letters are a symbol of athletic prowess, marking the idea that a student's hard work and achievement has earned them a right to represent their school.

fields.title: Free SAT will be offered at Blair in April
fields.description: A Scholastic Aptitude Test (SAT) will be administered at Blair for all interested juniors free of cost on the morning of April 10. The free test is part of a county-wide program being piloted at various high schools to grant all students access to college entrance exams.

fields.title: A dive into the wild
fields.description: At 2:30 p.m. the "want-to-go homers" flee from the school grounds and into the wild, or as we call it, the student parking lot. In the wild there are no rules - it's every man for himself. The strong ones manage to make it out, but the weak are stuck behind, left to fight it out in the line behind the buses.

fields.title: MoCo students participate in #National Walkout Day
fields.description: Montgomery Blair High School students walked out of school to participate in #NationalWalkoutDay, joining students from across Montgomery County. The walkout culminated in 17 minutes of silence in front of the White House, after which they marched to the Capitol to listen to several speakers.

fields.title: The come up of eSports
fields.description: Nervous athletes pray that their hours of practice pay off, downing energy drinks before heading off to play. Devoted fans pack the arena, wearing the merchandise of their favorite teams. This is not your average Sunday night football game: this is eSports.

fields.title: Civil War names in Takoma Park?
fields.description: The city of Takoma Park is considering renaming streets that honor Union and Confederate Civil War figures. Grant, Sheridan, Sherman, General Lee and General Jackson avenues were debated on March 4th in a town hall meeting.

fields.title: Two students shot and wounded at General Mills High School
fields.description: A male student shot two fellow students with a handgun at Great Mills High School on Tuesday at 7:45 a.m. before he was fatally wounded in a standoff with the school's resource officer.

fields.title: Student brings loaded gun to school
fields.description: Senior Alwin Chen, 18, was arrested at Clarksburg High School on Thursday, Feb. 15 at 2:20 pm, after he was found with a loaded 9mm handgun in his backpack, a knife in his pocket and a list of grievances against other students. On Tuesday, Feb. 20, police released a statement that they had searched Chen's home and found replica, non-explosive grenades and firing devices. Chen is being held without bond until his trial.

fields.title: Women make history
fields.description: Malala. Beyonce. Michelle Obama. These are just a few of the amazing women that will go down in history as the inspirational advocates for female empowerment. Although many female heroes are well known, there are many others who are not as widely acknowledged.

fields.title: Montgomery County cuts $25 million from MCPS budget
Why Online School?
fields.description: "At the time I was dealing with a combination of depression, anxiety, an eating disorder and an unhealthy relationship," explains sophomore Ruby Farber who recently returned to Blair after a semester of online schooling.

fields.title: NBA Award Predictions
fields.description: There are 3 candidates for each award every year. Here we will try to predict both the 3 candidates and the winner of all the awards, which will be given out at the NBA Award show on June 25th.

fields.title: Parkland shooting begins to inspire new gun control legislation
fields.description: In the wake of the shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Fl. on Feb. 14, 2018, that left 17 dead, students across the country flocked to the streets to protest for stricter gun control laws. However, these protests have not yet had their desired effect, as only two of several proposed lawshave actually been passed since the Parkland shooting. So, what is currently being done by government officials in response to recent gun violence?

fields.title: Teachers fight for fair wages
fields.description: Instead of worrying about if her students would eat dinner or if they have a proper set of gloves, West Virginia teacher, Tiffany Bell, is troubled about how much money she has in her bank account. She wonders what her family will eat for dinner or whether she has enough in her checking account to purchase a winter coat.

fields.title: Flu epidemic sweeps across Montgomery County
fields.description: The flu season was officially deemed an epidemic in Montgomery County in January as the numbers of flu patients continued to rise, shaping the 2018 flu season to be the worst in over a decade.

fields.title: Football, Friend, Family
fields.description: The media has become a revolutionizing force, both in shaping the railways of communication and our everyday lives. But perhaps, it is time to take a step back and reflect on how it has impacted our perception of reality. Yes, and there is no better field to explore this topic than that of youth tackle football, an issue that, regrettably, has been assailed by the media as a detriment to the future of America.

fields.title: Blair's new security system aims to enhance school safety
fields.description: As a result of new MCPS regulations, the doors on the Colesville Road side of Blair remain locked from  8 a.m to 2:30 p.m. Montgomery Blair principal, Renay Johnson, implemented the new safety measure two weeks after the shooting at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Parkland, Fl.

fields.title: NHL Playoff Preview
fields.description: Today we will be dissecting each of the first round NHL playoff matchups and predicting the winner in each series along with the amount of games the series will last. See what SCO has to say!

fields.title: My teachers can barely use Canvas. Why on earth would we give them guns?
fields.description: After the recent Parkland shooting, there has been a heated debate over whether teachers should be armed.

fields.title: A night to remember
fields.description: Red, gold, dragons, cherry blossoms and torii gates have more in common than just being different parts of Chinese and Japanese culture.

fields.title: Augmented Reality: a new way to see the world
fields.description: On April 6th and 7th, thousands of people across America gathered at the Washington Convention Center for the biennialUSA Science and Engineering festival expo. Over 3000 organizations, including Lockheed Martin, NASA and the Department of Defense, came out to display their cutting-edge technology. One of the most interesting types of technology featured at the Expo was augmented reality (AR).

fields.title: Ready Player One is a nice trip back to the 80s
fields.description: Based on the bestselling novel written by Ernest Cline, Ready Player One directed by Steven Spielberg, is set in the year 2045 in Oklahoma City, an industrial shell of a city. To escape their current situation, residents spend most of their time in the OASIS, a Virtual Reality simulator

fields.title: Student escapes kidnapper
fields.description: An unidentified male suspect attempted to kidnap a Montgomery County teen in Germantown, Maryland on Friday, Apr. 6. The 14 year old girl was able to escape safely despite the suspect's advances.

fields.title: U.S. strikes Syria
fields.description: On Saturday, April 14, the United States, Britain and France carried out airstrikes against suspected Syrian chemical weapon facilities.

fields.title: A quiet place, a loud theater
fields.description: If you're looking for the typical paranormal, blood-gushing horror movie, A Quiet Place would be a waste of your time. A Quiet Place is a horror film in a class of its own.

fields.title: Augmented Reality: a new way to see the world
fields.description: On April 6 and 7, thousands of people across America gathered at the Washington Convention Center for the biennial USA Science and Engineering festival expo.

fields.title: Only a fool would extend school
fields.description: MCPS plans to close the ever-growing achievement gap between low and high income students with a new strategy: an extended school year.

fields.title: Don't be rash when approving medications
fields.description: Parkinson's Disease is a devastating neurological disorder affecting about 1 million Americans. The degenerative disease is marked by tremors, difficulty moving, and slurred speech, and can eventually lead to dementia and depression. So when the drug Nuplazid was developed, which could effectively treat the psychosis associated with Parkinson's, it was natural that everyone wanted the medication available as quickly as possible.

fields.title: For Muslims, "punish a Muslim day" is basically every day
fields.description: One anonymous, hateful letter rattled United Kingdom communities on Apr. 3. The letter came in a plain white envelope and was sent to six different U.K. communities. Inside was a message that brought chaos and hysteria to the entire country.

fields.title: The new American Idol brings a new set of disappointing judges
fields.description: On Apr. 7 2016, Ryan Seacrest said his final goodbyes for the "farewell" season of American Idol...or so we thought.

fields.title: Blair Sports Go Roaring Into the Playoffs
fields.description: The regular season has ended and the animal of the playoffs has came. There are high hopes for many of the Blair teams with high expectations. Baseball, softball and lacrosse are all looking to get deep into the playoffs for the second straight year after a year in which all four teams got to the Regional finals.

fields.title: Dear Mom
fields.description: It is that time of year again! The time of year when you have a whole day dedicated exclusively to you. Today is Mother's Day, and oh are we here for it. We have so much to say to you and only one letter to say it all in. But if you'll read nothing else but this opening paragraph, please know that we love you, and we thank you for your never-ending care and support.

fields.title: Police arrest students involved in protest at Paul Ryan's office
fields.description: On May 18, four Montgomery County students, including Blair senior Brenna Levitan, were arrested at a lie-in protest at Speaker Paul Ryan's office. They were charged with "crowding, obstructing, or incommoding" according to the Huffington Post.

fields.title: From graduation day to landfills
fields.description: Graduation Day is coming soon, and this means seniors are preparing to be officially done with high school. But there is a whole other side to this very special day: shapeless red or white graduation gowns. The problem is that these gowns are only used once and then, often times, thrown out. Such a practice is not only a waste of fabric; it is also harmful to the ecosystem. Instead, Blair should donate these gowns to charities that use the fabric from graduation gowns to make other clothes.

fields.title: Lawmakers push back on T-Mobile and Sprint's merger
fields.description: T-Mobile and Sprint recently struck a merger deal, which would shrink the wireless telecommunications realm down to three main competitors.

fields.title: Post Malone's new album B&B receives an A+
fields.description: In just the few weeks since its April 27 release, Beerbongs and Bentleys, the second album by Austin Post (professionally known as Post Malone), has already proven to be a historical hit. It debuted at No. 1 on the US Billboard 200 and has held down the spot for three weeks, set national and global streaming record on Spotify and was certified Platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). However, these numerous awards and achievements are not necessary to understand the quality of the album; the music speaks for itself.

fields.title: Fortnite takes over lives in a fortnight
fields.description: If you have Twitter, you've undoubtedly seen Fortnite pictures, videos and references in your feed. The video game came out in July and gained popularity about two months ago, and now many teens spend an increasing amount of time playing either on their phone, computer or TV. While some people resent the amount of time their significant others are on the app, others have hopped on the bandwagon with their partners. In some cases, Fortnite even strengthens the relationships.
